DataElement.preferredName: Family Medical History Amsterdam Criteria I java.lang.String
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and disease events of blood relatives.  A patients family medical history may be important in diagnosing existing conditions. (NCI)_Research criteria established for defining Hereditary Non-Polyposis Colorectal Cancer (HNPCC) families as established by the International Collaborative Group (ICG) meeting in Amsterdam in 1990: 1. One member diagnosed with colorectal cancer before age 50; 2. Two affected generations; 3. Three affected relatives, 1 of them a first-degree relative of the other 2; 4. Familial adenomatous polyposis should be excluded; 5. Tumors should be verified by pathological examination._Generic value domain for a java datatype that is a class that represents character strings.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Family Medical History Amsterdam Criteria I
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and disease events of blood relatives.  A patients family medical history may be important in diagnosing existing conditions. (NCI)_Research criteria established for defining Hereditary Non-Polyposis Colorectal Cancer (HNPCC) families as established by the International Collaborative Group (ICG) meeting in Amsterdam in 1990: 1. One member diagnosed with colorectal cancer before age 50; 2. Two affected generations; 3. Three affected relatives, 1 of them a first-degree relative of the other 2; 4. Familial adenomatous polyposis should be excluded; 5. Tumors should be verified by pathological examination.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and disease events of blood relatives.  A patients family medical history may be important in diagnosing existing conditions. (NCI)
